Grid

  • 12 column grid with 2% gutters
  • Each row cannot exceed 12 columns
  • Last column requires the class last to remove the margin for old IE (CSS last-child fixes this for everything else).

The basic structure for a three column layout looks like this:



 First col 


 Second col 


 Third col

And that gives you:

First col
Second col
Third col

The reason it says "four-columns" is that each row is divided into 12 columns, so if you want a three column layout with all equal widths, you divide 12 by 3 which gives you 4.

Whatever type of layout you have, if you want to make it so every row has two columns for tablet screen sizes (between 401px and 767px), add the class tablet to the container.

If on desktop, resize your browser window to see these switch to a two column layout between 401px and 767px:
